info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 1:47PM MDT until July 07 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE MCBRIDE BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTH CENTRAL LINCOLN COUNTY... At 147 PM MDT, Earlier thunderstorms produced heavy rain over the northern portions of the McBride Burn Scar. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches fell previously, and excessive runoff, flooding and debris flows of water, rocks and timber have been observed by Emergency Management. Excessive rainfall and runoff over the burn scar has primarily impacted Eagle Creek Canyon Road and will continue to impact nearby areas downstream to the Rio Ruidoso. HAZARD...Earlier thunderstorms produced heavy rainfall and excessive runoff in and around the McBride Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...A continued threat for flash flooding and debris flows around the McBride Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ruidoso, Ruidoso Downs and Hollywood. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the McBride wildfire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
